title: 2010 Rally Sweden
bio: Mikko Hirvonen opened the season with a strong win in Sweden’s snowy forests, holding off Loeb in a tight finish.

title: 2010 Rally México
bio: Loeb bounced back on Mexican gravel, delivering a dominant performance to regain the championship lead.

title: 2010 Jordan Rally
bio: Loeb edged Latvala in one of the closest finishes in WRC history, winning by just 0.2 seconds.

title: 2010 Rally of Turkey
bio: Petter Solberg showed flashes of his past brilliance, finishing second behind Loeb in the rough Turkish stages.

title: 2010 Rally New Zealand
bio: Latvala took his only win of the season after Loeb and Ogier made costly errors in a chaotic final stage.

title: 2010 Rally Finland
bio: Loeb conquered Finland for the first time, breaking the Scandinavian stronghold on the event with surgical pace.

title: 2010 Rallye Deutschland
bio: Loeb extended his German dominance with a clinical win on his favorite tarmac stages, pushing toward another title.

title: 2010 Rallye de France (Alsace)
bio: Loeb won his seventh WRC title at home in France, becoming the most successful WRC driver ever in front of his hometown fans.

title: 2010 Wales Rally GB
bio: Latvala won the final round in Wales, but Loeb’s consistency had already secured him the championship.

title: 2011 Rally Sweden
bio: Mikko Hirvonen started the new WRC era with a win in Sweden, leading a Ford 1–2–3 and setting the tone for a close title fight.

title: 2011 Rally México
bio: Sébastien Loeb struck back on gravel with a commanding win in Mexico, proving the DS3 WRC was up to the task.

title: 2011 Rally Portugal
bio: Ogier took a breakthrough win in Portugal, beating Loeb in a clean fight and declaring himself a title contender.

title: 2011 Jordan Rally
bio: Ogier narrowly defeated Latvala by 0.2 seconds in the second-closest finish in WRC history.

title: 2011 Rally Argentina
bio: Loeb pulled off a stunning comeback after a bad road position, winning on the final stage after a three-way battle.

title: 2011 Rally Finland
bio: Ogier won in Finland — a rare feat for a non-Scandinavian — proving his gravel pace was world class.

title: 2011 Rallye Deutschland
bio: Loeb dominated tarmac again in Germany, making no mistakes while his rivals faltered.

title: 2011 Rally France (Alsace)
bio: Loeb retired early with engine failure, allowing Hirvonen to take the win and bring the title fight to the wire.

title: 2011 Wales Rally GB
bio: Hirvonen retired with radiator damage after hitting a log, handing Loeb his 8th consecutive world title despite crashing out himself.

title: 2012 Monte Carlo Rally
bio: Back on the calendar after a 3-year break, Monte Carlo was conquered by Loeb with signature confidence on slick mountain roads.

title: 2012 Rally Sweden
bio: Jari-Matti Latvala delivered a strong win on snow, keeping Ford in the title hunt with a dominant drive.

title: 2012 Rally Mexico
bio: Loeb returned to the top on Mexican gravel, edging out Hirvonen in a Citroën 1–2 finish.

title: 2012 Rally Portugal
bio: Mads Østberg was awarded the win after Hirvonen was excluded for a technical infringement, marking the Norwegian’s first career WRC victory.

title: 2012 Rally Argentina
bio: Loeb showed off-road dominance again, winning in Argentina despite pressure from Latvala and Østberg.

title: 2012 Rallye Deutschland
bio: Loeb won his ninth consecutive Germany rally, continuing his dominance on tarmac and all but sealing the title.

title: 2012 Rallye de France – Alsace
bio: Loeb sealed his **ninth and final WRC championship** with a victory at home in Alsace, bringing his full-time career to a perfect close.

title: 2012 Rally Catalunya (Spain)
bio: Latvala claimed victory in Spain with Ford’s final factory WRC event before withdrawing, ending an era.

title: 2012 Rally GB (Wales)
bio: Loeb finished second behind Latvala, closing out the season with his 113th career podium and retiring as a nine-time WRC champion.

title: 2013 Rallye Monte-Carlo
bio: Loeb returned for a part-time campaign and won Monte Carlo with vintage precision under icy, changing conditions.

title: 2013 Rally Sweden
bio: Sébastien Ogier earned Volkswagen’s first WRC win on just their second event, signaling the start of a new era.

title: 2013 Rally Mexico
bio: Ogier destroyed the field on Mexico’s gravel, earning his second straight win and the points lead.

title: 2013 Rally Argentina
bio: Loeb took a thrilling win over Ogier in Argentina — their final head-to-head battle before Loeb stepped away.

title: 2013 Rally Finland
bio: Ogier conquered Finland with a near-flawless performance, further solidifying his grip on the championship.

title: 2013 Rallye Deutschland
bio: Dani Sordo claimed his first career WRC win in Germany after Ogier and Latvala crashed on tarmac.

title: 2013 Rally Australia
bio: Ogier cruised to victory in the forests of Australia, setting up a title win on the next round.

title: 2013 Rallye de France (Alsace)
bio: Ogier sealed his first WRC title at home in France with a controlled drive and emotional celebration.

title: 2013 Wales Rally GB
bio: Latvala ended the season with a win for Volkswagen in Wales, giving the team a dominant 1–3 title finish.

title: 2014 Rallye Monte-Carlo
bio: Bouffier led early in changing conditions, but Ogier surged back with late-stage brilliance to win his first Monte Carlo.

title: 2014 Rally Sweden
bio: Latvala outpaced his teammate Ogier on snow, winning Sweden and igniting a true title battle within VW.

title: 2014 Rally Mexico
bio: Ogier won comfortably in Mexico’s high-altitude gravel, showing VW’s pace was still unmatched.

title: 2014 Rally Portugal
bio: Latvala took his second win of the season after Ogier made an uncharacteristic early error.

title: 2014 Rally Argentina
bio: Latvala claimed a hard-fought victory on rough Argentine roads, continuing to pressure Ogier in the standings.

title: 2014 Rally Finland
bio: Ogier finally won Rally Finland, overcoming the Finnish stronghold with unmatched consistency and speed.

title: 2014 Rallye Deutschland
bio: Hyundai’s Thierry Neuville scored his first career win after both VW drivers crashed out on tarmac.

title: 2014 Rally France (Alsace)
bio: Latvala bounced back with a win on Loeb’s former home turf, keeping the title alive with two rounds to go.

title: 2014 Wales Rally GB
bio: Ogier locked up his second world title with a dominant win in the muddy forests of Wales.

title: 2015 Rallye Monte-Carlo
bio: Ogier started his title defense with a confident win on home tarmac and ice, keeping VW’s streak alive.

title: 2015 Rally Sweden
bio: Ogier edged out Thierry Neuville in a nail-biting snow battle, winning by less than a second on the final stage.

title: 2015 Rally Mexico
bio: Ogier dominated Mexico’s gravel roads for a third consecutive win, extending his championship lead.

title: 2015 Rally Argentina
bio: Kris Meeke broke VW’s streak with a massive win in Argentina for Citroën, marking his first career victory.

title: 2015 Rally Portugal
bio: Ogier struck back in Portugal, holding off Latvala in a tight fight through dusty mountain passes.

title: 2015 Rally Finland
bio: Jari-Matti Latvala thrilled the home fans with a near-perfect run through Finland’s lightning-fast jumps and forests.

title: 2015 Rallye Deutschland
bio: Ogier returned to dominance on tarmac, conquering Germany with clean and calculated pace.

title: 2015 Tour de Corse (France)
bio: Elfyn Evans nearly stole the win, but Latvala held strong to take his first Corsica victory for VW.

title: 2015 Wales Rally GB
bio: Ogier wrapped up the season with another dominant display in the Welsh mud, securing his third straight title.

title: 2016 Rallye Monte-Carlo
bio: Ogier kicked off the season with a dominant win on home roads, navigating tricky ice and tarmac in Monte Carlo.

title: 2016 Rally Sweden
bio: Hayden Paddon pushed Ogier hard, but the Frenchman held on to win Sweden by a slim margin.

title: 2016 Rally Mexico
bio: Ogier extended his points lead with another confident gravel win under the hot Mexican sun.

title: 2016 Rally Argentina
bio: Hayden Paddon took a career-first victory, beating Ogier in a dramatic showdown and making history for Hyundai.

title: 2016 Rally Poland
bio: Andreas Mikkelsen stormed to his second career win after a tight duel with Ott Tänak, giving VW a late-season boost.

title: 2016 Rally Finland
bio: Kris Meeke crushed the competition in Finland, becoming the first non-Nordic driver to win with such a margin.

title: 2016 Tour de Corse (France)
bio: Ogier dominated Corsica’s technical tarmac stages, cruising to another flawless French win.

title: 2016 Wales Rally GB
bio: Ogier sealed his fourth WRC title in the Welsh forests, delivering one final title-winning performance for Volkswagen.

title: 2017 Rallye Monte-Carlo
bio: Ogier won a dramatic season opener for M-Sport after Neuville crashed from the lead in icy conditions.

title: 2017 Rally Sweden
bio: Jari-Matti Latvala delivered Toyota’s first WRC win since 1999, dominating snow-covered Swedish roads.

title: 2017 Rally Mexico
bio: Kris Meeke won in Mexico despite a last-stage off into a spectator parking lot, recovering to finish seconds ahead of Ogier.

title: 2017 Tour de Corse
bio: Thierry Neuville claimed his first win of the season after Ogier struggled and mechanical issues slowed Meeke.

title: 2017 Rally Portugal
bio: Ogier increased his points lead with a clean win on Portuguese gravel, outpacing Tänak and Neuville.

title: 2017 Rally Finland
bio: Esapekka Lappi stunned the field with a win at home in only his fourth WRC start, giving Toyota their second win of the season.

title: 2017 Rallye Deutschland
bio: Ott Tänak drove clean and fast to take his first career WRC win for M-Sport on mixed-surface tarmac.

title: 2017 Wales Rally GB
bio: Elfyn Evans took a commanding win at home in wet Welsh conditions, giving DMACK its first and only WRC victory.

title: 2017 Rally Australia
bio: Neuville won the final round, but Ogier’s consistency across the season gave him his fifth WRC title — this time with M-Sport Ford.

title: 2018 Rallye Monte-Carlo
bio: Ogier narrowly beat Neuville in ever-changing Monte Carlo conditions to start his title defense with a win.

title: 2018 Rally Sweden
bio: Neuville bounced back with a dominant snow win in Sweden, taking the early points lead from Ogier.

title: 2018 Rally Mexico
bio: Ogier won in Mexico for the fourth time, showing masterful gravel control and regaining the championship lead.

title: 2018 Rally Argentina
bio: Ott Tänak gave Toyota a crushing win on Argentina’s rough gravel, signaling his rise as a true title challenger.

title: 2018 Rally Finland
bio: Tänak repeated his domination in Finland, winning from start to finish in high-speed style.

title: 2018 Rallye Deutschland
bio: Tänak completed a hat trick of wins, mastering mixed German tarmac while rivals struggled.

title: 2018 Rally Spain
bio: Sébastien Loeb shocked the field with a surprise comeback win in Spain, his first WRC victory since 2013.

title: 2018 Rally Australia
bio: Ogier played it smart while Tänak and Neuville crashed, securing his 6th WRC title in dramatic fashion.

title: 2019 Rallye Monte-Carlo
bio: Ogier won Monte Carlo by just 2.2 seconds over Neuville, starting the season strong in his Citroën return.

title: 2019 Rally Sweden
bio: Ott Tänak took control in Sweden with a commanding snow win, his first step toward the title.

title: 2019 Rally Mexico
bio: Ogier dominated Mexico once again, staying in the championship hunt with a clean gravel victory.

title: 2019 Tour de Corse
bio: Elfyn Evans led most of the rally, but a last-stage puncture handed the win to Thierry Neuville.

title: 2019 Rally Argentina
bio: Tänak dominated Argentina’s rough stages, putting Toyota back in the championship lead.

title: 2019 Rally Finland
bio: Tänak repeated his high-speed masterclass in Finland, extending his title lead.

title: 2019 Rally Germany
bio: Tänak won his third tarmac event in a row, proving unstoppable with his Toyota on all surfaces.

title: 2019 Rally Spain
bio: Neuville won in Spain, but Tänak finished second — enough to clinch his first WRC title with one round to spare.

title: 2019 Rally Australia (Cancelled)
bio: Rally Australia was cancelled due to bushfires in New South Wales. The championship concluded early with Tänak crowned champion.
